com.raweng.built

Class BuiltApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltApplication

  • public class BuiltApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    To fetch application level information of your application from Built.io Backend server.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String value)
        To set headers for Built.io Backend rest calls.
        Parameters:
        key - header name.
        value - header value against given header name.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 builtApplication.setHeader("custom_header_key","custom_header_value");

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headerHashMap)
        To set headers for Built.io Backend rest calls.
        Parameters:
        headerHashMap - header name and value in hash map.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

 HashMap<String, String> headerHashMap = new HashMap<String, String>();
 headerHashMap.put("custom_header_key","custom_header_value");

 builtApplication.setHeader(headerHashMap);

      • setURL

        @Deprecated
public void setURL(java.lang.String hostName,
                     boolean isSSL)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the URL and host name of the Built.io Backend server.
        Parameters:
        hostName - host name.
        isSSL - true/false values initiating calls (HTTPS/HTTP) respectively.

        Note: Default hostname sets to api.built.io and default protocol is HTTPS.

        Example :

         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 builtApplication.setURL("api.built.io", true);

        Note: Default hostname sets to api.built.io and default protocol is HTTPS.

        Example :

         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key

 builtApplication.setRealTimeURL("api.built.io", true);

      • setCachePolicy

        public void setCachePolicy(Built.BuiltCachePolicy cachePolicy)
        To set cache policy Globally for BuiltQuery.
        Parameters:
        cachePolicy - cache policy from Built.BuiltCachePolicy.

        Note: Default cache policy is set to Built.BuiltCachePolicy.IGNORE_CACHE.

        Example :

         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 builtApplication.setGlobalCachePolicy(BuiltQuery.CachePolicy.NETWORK_ONLY);

      • enableRealTime

        public void enableRealTime(com.raweng.built.BuiltRealTimeCallback realTimeCallback)
        Enables realtime connection. All requests to the server would be made through a socket. [Only avaliable with realtime]
        Parameters:
        realTimeCallback - BuiltRealTimeCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key.
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

 builtApplication.enableRealTime(new BuiltRealTimeCallback() {

      @Override
      public void onRealtimeError(BuiltApplication application, BuiltError builtError) {

      }

      @Override
      public void onRealtimeConnect(BuiltApplication application) {

      }

      @Override
      public void onRealtimeDisconnect(BuiltApplication application) {

      }

      @Override
      public void onRealtimeWillReconnect(BuiltApplication application) {

      }

 });
 OR  [If BuiltRealTimeCallback interface is implemented]

 //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key.
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
        
 builtApplication.enableRealTime(context)

      • disableRealTime

        public void disableRealTime()
        Disables realtime connection. All requests to the server would be made using HTTP. [Only avaliable with realtime]

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 builtApplication.disableRealTime();

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String message,
             com.raweng.built.BuiltBroadCastCallback callback)
        Send a broadcast message.
        At first user need to start event listener on "Broadcast".
        [Only avaliable with realtime]
        Parameters:
        message - message String.
        callback - BuiltBroadCastCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

 builtApplication.broadcast("Hello world", new BuiltBroadCastCallback() {

      @Override
      public void onCompletion(BuiltConstant.ResponseType responseType, BuiltError builtError) {
        if(error == null){
          // broadcast message sent successfully.
        }else{
          // some error occurred while listening.
        }
      }
  });

      • on

        public void on(Built.EventType eventType,
      com.raweng.built.BuiltOnEventCallback callback)
        This function registers an event listener.

        [Only avaliable with realtime]
        Parameters:
        eventType - event name.
        callback - BuiltOnEventCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.

        Given below is the list of supported events.

        Create :- The 'create' event is triggered when a new class is created in this application. Registered callback is invoked with the created class data.

        Update :- Update event is triggered when any class in this application is modified. Registered callback is invoked with the updated class data.

        Delete :- Delete event is triggered when any class in this application is deleted. Registered callback is invoked with the deleted class data.

        Broadcast :- Broadcast event is triggered when a message is broadcast for all classes belonging to this application. Registered callback is invoked with the broadcast message.



        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

 builtApplication.on(Built.EventType.UPDATE, new BuiltOnEventCallback() {

      @Override
      public void onReceive(Object object, BuiltError error) {
        if(error == null){
           // success block.
           //class schema modification get return JSONArray instance in response which is recently updated.
           JSONArray schemaArray = (JSONArray) object;
        }else{
          //some error occurred while listening.
        }
      }
 });

      • off

        public void off(Built.EventType eventType,
       com.raweng.built.BuiltOffEventCallback callback)
        This function unregisters one or all event listener(s).

        [Only avaliable with realtime]
        Parameters:
        eventType - event name.
        callback - BuiltOffEventCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

 builtApplication.off(Built.EventType.UPDATE, new BuiltOffEventCallback() {

  @Override
  public void onCompletion(BuiltConstant.ResponseType responseType, BuiltError error) {
        if(error == null){
           // success block.
        }else{
          //some error occurred while turning off listener.
        }
  }
 });

      • getCurrentUser

        public BuiltUser getCurrentUser()
        This retrieves the currently logged in BuiltUser from disc.
        Returns:
        BuiltUser instance.

        Note :-

      • This method will return logged-in user if any else, returns null.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltUser user = builtApplication.getCurrentUser();

 if(user != null){
     //currently user is logged in.
 }

      • currentInstallation

        public BuiltInstallation currentInstallation()
        Gets current installation details which is made from device.

        Note: You can access application installations data by accessing BuiltInstallation.getDeviceType(), BuiltInstallation.getDeviceToken(), BuiltInstallation.getSubscribedChannelList()

        Example :

         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltInstallation installation = builtApplication.currentInstallation();

      • fetchClassesSchema

        public BuiltSynchronousResponse fetchClassesSchema()
        Fetch all application classes schema.
        Returns:
        BuiltSynchronousResponse object.


        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

  BuiltSynchronousResponse response = builtApplication.fetchClassesSchema()

  if(response.getBuiltError() == null){
      // success block
      HashMap<String, Object> schemaHashMap = (HashMap<String, Object>)response.getResponseData();
  }

      • fetchClassesSchemaInBackground

        public BuiltApplication fetchClassesSchemaInBackground(com.raweng.built.BuiltFetchSchemaCallback callback)
        Fetch all application classes schema.
        Parameters:
        callback - BuiltFetchSchemaCallback object to notify the application when the request has completed.
        Returns:
        BuiltApplication object, so you can chain this call.


        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

  builtApplication.fetchClassesSchemaInBackground(new BuiltFetchSchemaCallback() {

      @Override
        
      public void onCompletion(ResponseType responseType, Object object, BuiltError builtError {

      }
  });

      • fetchLastActivities

        public BuiltSynchronousResponse fetchLastActivities()
        Fetching last activity of all classes.
        Returns:
        BuiltSynchronousResponse object.


        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");

  BuiltSynchronousResponse response = builtApplication.fetchLastActivities()

  if(response.getBuiltError() == null){
      // success block
      HashMap<String, Object> schemaHashMap = (HashMap<String, Object>)response.getResponseData();
  }

  }

      • getUsersQuery

        public BuiltQuery getUsersQuery()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides BuiltQuery object to retrieve application use.
        Returns:
        BuiltQuery object.

        Note :- This method returns an object of BuiltQuery class, all the methods of the BuiltQuery class are available and can be used to query the Application user class of Built.io Backend.
        User can get list of BuiltUser objects using QueryResult.getUsers() in success callback of BuiltQuery.exec(QueryResultsCallBack) method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
  BuiltQuery userQuery      = builtApplication.getUsersQuery();

      • getRolesQuery

        public BuiltQuery getRolesQuery()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides BuiltQuery object to retrieve application roles.
        Note :- This method returns an object of BuiltQuery class, all the methods of the BuiltQuery class are available and can be used to query the "Application User Role" class of Built.io Backend.
        User can get list of BuiltRole objects using QueryResult.getRoles() in success callback of BuiltQuery.exec(QueryResultsCallBack) method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
  BuiltQuery roleQuery      = builtApplication.getRolesQuery();

      • getApplicationVariableForKey

        public java.lang.String getApplicationVariableForKey(java.lang.String key)
        To get value of the application variable for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the application variable.
        Returns:
        the value for the given key.

        Example :
          String value   = builtApplication.getApplicationVariableForKey("key");

      • toJSON

        public JSONObject toJSON()
        Returns JSON representation of this BuiltApplication instance data.

        Example :
          JSONObject applicationJson   = builtApplication.toJSON();
